alert.note: Alert for York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 4:26PM EDT until May 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, York. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This may cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.8 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 0.3 to 0.5 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... York, Weigelstown, Shiloh, East York, West York, Grantley, Tyler Run-Queens Gate, Valley View, Emigsville, Spring Grove, Dover, North York, York Airport, New Salem, Wellsville, Ski Roundtop Ski Area, York College Of Pennsylvania and Penn State York. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
